intro: Milla porrifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Milla porrifolia is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
